Package imagingbook.pub.corners.subpixel

Interface MaxLocator_OLD

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic1, MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic2, MaxLocator_OLD.Quartic
    public interface MaxLocator_OLD
    The common interface for all sub-pixel locators in this package.
    Version:
    2020/10/03
    See Also:
    MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic1, MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic2, MaxLocator_OLD.Quartic

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  MaxLocator_OLD.Method
      Enumeration of keys for MaxLocator_OLD methods.
      static class  MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic1
      2D interpolator based on fitting a quadratic polynomial (axis-parallel paraboloid, with no mixed terms) of the form
      f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2
      to the supplied samples.
      static class  MaxLocator_OLD.Quadratic2
      2D interpolator based on fitting a quadratic polynomial (non-axis-parallel paraboloid, including mixed terms) of the form
      f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 xy
      to the supplied samples.
      static class  MaxLocator_OLD.Quartic
      2D interpolator based on fitting a 'quartic' (i.e., 4th-order) polynomial of the form
      f(x,y) = c_0 + c_1 x + c_2 y + c_3 x^2 + c_4 y^2 + c_5 x y + c_6 x^2 y + c_7 x y^2 + c_8 x^2 y^2
      to the supplied samples.

      static MaxLocator_OLD getInstance​(MaxLocator_OLD.Method m)
      Creates a specific MaxLocator_OLD instance based on the supplied MaxLocator_OLD.Method key.
      float[] getInterpolatedMax​(float[] s)
      Tries to locate the sub-pixel maximum from the 9 discrete sample values (s0,...,s8) taken from a 3x3 neigborhood, arranged in the following order:

    • Method Detail

      • getInterpolatedMax

        float[] getInterpolatedMax​(float[] s)
        Tries to locate the sub-pixel maximum from the 9 discrete sample values (s0,...,s8) taken from a 3x3 neigborhood, arranged in the following order: 
         s4 s3 s2
 s5 s0 s1
 s6 s7 s8
        The center value (s0) is assumed to be at position (0,0).
        Parameters:
        s - a vector containing 9 sample values in the order described above
        Returns:
        a 3-element array [x,y,z], with the estimated maximum position (x,y) and the associated max. value (z). The position is relative to the center coordinate (0,0). null is returned if the maximum position could not be located.

      • getInstance

        static MaxLocator_OLD getInstance​(MaxLocator_OLD.Method m)
        Creates a specific MaxLocator_OLD instance based on the supplied MaxLocator_OLD.Method key.
        Parameters:
        m - the method
        Returns:
        a new MaxLocator_OLD instance
